bibl.title: New texts from early Islamic Egypt: a bilingual taxation archive
bibl.seg: Jennifer Cromwell, New Texts from Early Islamic Egypt: A Bilingual Taxation Archive.

Edition of a group of tax receipts for the poll tax (διάγραφον) and a loan agreement, all belonging to the same man, Cosma son of Prow (his brother Johannes appears in a couple of receipts). - Part I. The tax receipts: 1. P. Mich. inv. 527 (10th indiction); - 2. P. Mich. inv. 761 (2nd indiction); - 3. P. Mich. inv. 1834 (1st indiction); - 4. P. Mich. inv. 1836 (2nd indiction); - 5. P. Mich. inv. 1837 (11th indiction); - 6. P. Mich. inv. 1840 (= S.B. XVI, 13043; S.B. Kopt. II, 1016; 8th indiction); - 7. P. Mich. inv. 1842 (= S.B. XVI, 13044; S.B. Kopt. II, 1017; 5th indiction); - 8. P. Mich. inv. 1844 (6th indiction); - 9. P. Mich. inv. 1848 (15th indiction); - 10. P. Mich. inv. 1849 (7th indiction); - 11. P. Mich. inv. 1850 (12th indiction). - Part II. Loan agreement: P. Mich. inv. 1843. - Part III. Discussion: Form and language; - Scribes and signaries; - Re-Use; - Provenance and date (Hermopolite nome?, early 8th century).
